examples: She left the house an hour ago.
He graduated from college three years ago.
The event took place a long time ago.
Ela saiu de casa uma hora atrás.
Ele se formou na faculdade há três anos.
O evento aconteceu há muito tempo.

suggested: Why couldn't the bicycle stand up by itself? It was two-tired...and this joke is so old, it feels like it happened 'ago'!
The concept of time can be bittersweet, and thinking about something that happened 'ago' can bring up feelings of nostalgia or regret.
It can be frustrating when someone brings up something you did 'ago' as if it's still relevant or you haven't grown and changed since then.
Did you know that the word 'ago' comes from the Middle English word 'agone', which means 'departed, passed away'?
There's no specific smell associated with 'ago', but the scent of something that reminds you of a time in the past can evoke powerful memories.
There's no physical sensation associated with 'ago', but the feeling of looking back on a time or event can be visceral.
The concept of 'ago' can be connected to the ideas of history, memory, and the passage of time.
